headline: Assistant Chief Counsel at Immigration and Customs Enforcement
summary: I serve as a trial attorney for DHS ICE in Louisville, KY. Prior to transferring, I worked for almost two years down at the Stewart Detention Center litigating detained immigration cases on behalf of DHS. I also continue to serve in the Army Reserve as a Judge Advocate.

positions.description: The last two years I served on Active Duty as a Judge Advocate with The United States Army Recruiting Command. I started as a Reservist in 2012. Starting in 2015, I have served on Active Duty at Fort Knox as an Administrative Law Attorney.  This past year I served with the 6th Recruiting Brigade. I serve as Trial Counsel/Special Mission Counsel in Las Vegas, NV. As a reservist, I previously served as Trial Counsel for 143rd ESC and was a member of the Rule of Law team with the 12th LOD. I currently serve as Trial Counsel with the 359th TTSB.
positions.title: CPT, Judge Advocate

positions.companyName: Florida Office of the Attorney General
positions.description: I am a Senior Attorney in the Child Support Enforcement unit which represents Florida's Department of Revenue. I cover two divisions of enforcement and establishment cases. I litigate paternity actions, child support modifications and establishment cases, and enforcement proceedings such as contempts.
positions.title: Assistant Attorney General

positions.companyName: Coast to Coast Legal Aid of South Florida
positions.description: Worked under the Department of the Veterans Affairs Supportive Services for Veteran Families Program as a member of Coast to Coast Legal Aid of South Florida.  Advised and litigated on behalf of veterans on issues involving Family Law, Employment Law, VA claims, and Social Security/Disability.
positions.title: Staff Attorney

positions.description: While at the Kastelz Law Group, I litigated family, criminal, foreclosure defense, and bankruptcy cases while managing all my case files from beginning to end.  I handled divorces, modifications of time sharing, and modifications of child support.  My criminal law experience consists of felonies ranging from drug offenses to fraud.  I have extensive motion practice and trial experience.  I argued several summary judgment motions weekly on my foreclosure files and have criminal and civil trial experience.  I covered all the firmâs bankruptcy hearings and the firmâs appellate work.  From July 2013 to October 2013, I served as Conflict Counsel for St. John's county.
positions.title: Associate

positions.description:
Main responsibilities consisted of research and writing on Federal evidentiary and criminal procedure issues.
Researched and prepared documents relevant to pending cases.
positions.title: Summer Associate

positions.description: Primary responsibility was to write drafts of appellate briefs for the State of Florida.  Conducted all the research for the briefs and determined the legal issues independently.
positions.title: Law Intern
